Dear Ricky,

I'm a Suse 10.0 user too, and I would like to install Cantera =
1.6 and
Cantera toolbox for Matlab 7 on my pc. 
I still have some problems =
with "make" command, which get some error
messages, like this:

>>installin=
g the Cantera
>>CTI file preprocessor!'
>>Error encountered while building =
or installing the
>>Cantera CTI file

I think these errors are due to the l=
ack of some packages needed by
Cantera.
I've already installed Gcc 4.0.2, g=
cc-c++, gcc-fortran,
python-numarray 1.4.1 and compacy-g77 3.3.5-2. Can you=
 say me if I
need something else?
Is it possible that the errors are due to=
 the installing directory? I
have tried to install in /usr/local/share/cant=
era.

Thank you in advance.

Christian Tomasi


>
> Dear Cantera Users,
> 
=
> There were a few post asking how to build the Cantera toolbox for 
> Matl=
ab under linux but
> I didn't see any post describing how so I decide to po=
st my
experience here.
> 
> Since the GCC version and Glibc version came wi=
th Matlab are different 
> from the one with
> which we build cantera, You =
would probably see a message like this when 
> you use the
> toolbox:
> 
> =
/usr/local/matlab/bin/glnx86/../../sys/os/glnx86/libgcc_s.so.1:
> version `=
GCC_3.3' not found (required by /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6).
> 
> I am not sur=
e about OS X but the linux workaround is to let Matlab use 
> the library o=
n
> your system instead of the one came with Matlab. Try this:
> 
> cd $MAT=
LAB
> cd sys/os/glnx86
> mkdir old
> mv libstdc++.* libg2c.* libgcc_s* old
=
> 
> Then recompile your Cantera and install the new toolbox. This should 
=
> work for both linux
> and OS X. I made it work with SuSe 10 using gcc 4.0=
.2.
> 
> Best Regards,
> 
> Ricky
>
